eu.cqse.check.framework.util.tokens

Class TokenPattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.util.tokens.TokenPattern

  • public class TokenPattern
extends java.lang.Object
    A pattern that can be applied like a regular expression to a token stream. This class is not fully redundant to TokenTypePattern for two reasons:
    • It allows matching nested structures, e.g. parentheses, with skipNested(Object, Object, boolean)
    • It allows named capture groups, something which is not currently possible with Java 7: http://bugs.java.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=8013252
    TODO (BH): I think there is still lots of potential for improvement in this class. Many of the matchers seem somewhat redundant. However, I would rather wait for the next round of improvements, as then the code should be easier to read. (Note to self: another full review ahead :))

      • findAll

        public java.util.List<TokenPatternMatch> findAll(java.util.List<IToken> tokens)
        Matches the pattern at all positions in the given token stream and returns the found matches. This also finds overlapping matches.

      • findFirstMatch

        public TokenPatternMatch findFirstMatch(java.util.List<IToken> tokens)
        Matches the pattern at all positions in the given token stream and returns the first found match or null if no match happened.

      • matchesAnywhere

        public boolean matchesAnywhere(java.util.List<IToken> tokens)
        Returns true if the pattern matches at least once in the given token stream.

      • group

        public TokenPattern group(int groupIndex)
        Specifies that the last added subpattern should be appended to the group with the given index. The group index may be any integer number. Group indices are not required to be ordered or continuous.

      • skipTo

        public TokenPattern skipTo(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Adds a new pattern part that consumes anything until it encounters one of the given match terms. The stop token matching one of the given terms is also consumed. A group applied to this pattern will only contain the stop token.
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them, as well as TokenPatterns.

      • skipNested

        public TokenPattern skipNested(java.lang.Object openTerm,
                               java.lang.Object closeTerm,
                               boolean optional)
        Adds a new pattern part that consumes nested structures.
        Parameters:
        openTerm - a match term that identifies the opening braces. May be an instance of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or a set of them, as well as an TokenPattern.
        closeTerm - a match term that identifies the closing braces. May be an instance of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or a set of them, as well as an TokenPattern.
        optional - if this is false, the nested structure must be present or the pattern will not match. If this is true, this pattern may return an empty match.

      • repeated

        public TokenPattern repeated(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Adds a new pattern part that matches the given terms zero or more times in the given order.
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them, as well as TokenPatterns.

      • sequence

        public TokenPattern sequence(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Adds a new pattern part that matches the given terms exactly once in the given order.
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them, as well as TokenPatterns.

      • endOfStream

        public TokenPattern endOfStream()
        Adds a new pattern part that matches the end of the token stream (i.e. there are no more tokens to match).

      • beginningOfStream

        public TokenPattern beginningOfStream()
        Adds a new pattern part that matches the beginning of the token stream (i.e. no tokens have been consumed so far).

      • notAtBeginningOfStream

        public TokenPattern notAtBeginningOfStream()
        Adds a new pattern part that matches anything but the beginning of the token stream (i.e. at least one token has been consumed so far).

      • notFollowedBy

        public TokenPattern notFollowedBy(java.lang.Object matchTerm)
        Adds a new pattern part that matches if the last matched token is not followed by a token that matches the given term. This pattern part does not consume any tokens.
        Parameters:
        matchTerm - May be an instance of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or a set of them, as well as a TokenPattern.

      • notPrecededBy

        public TokenPattern notPrecededBy(java.lang.Object matchTerm)
        Adds a new pattern part that matches if the last matched token is not preceded by a token that matches the given term. This pattern part does not consume any tokens. NOTE: passing a TokenPattern to this function will not result in an exception, but it will not yield the intuitive result. The given pattern will be matched against the token stream, starting with the token preceding the current token. It is therefore discouraged to pass a TokenPattern to this function as it makes understanding the pattern difficult.
        Parameters:
        matchTerm - May be an instance of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or a set of them, but usually not a TokenPattern.

      • alternative

        public TokenPattern alternative(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Adds a new pattern part that tries the given match terms one after the other and stops as soon as one of them matches.
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them, as well as TokenPatterns.

      • optional

        public TokenPattern optional(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Adds a new pattern part that matches the given terms zero times or once in the given order.
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them, as well as TokenPatterns.
